item.title: Bone Health and Disorders Related to Bone Metabolism
item.description: Fundamental Aspects of Bone Function The dynamic nature of bone is characterized by ongoing cycles of bone breakdown by osteoclasts and bone formation by osteoblasts within specific bone remodelling compartments. Annually, approximately 10% of an adult’s bone mass undergoes this remodelling, which is crucial for both preserving bone strength and managing the body’s calcium levels. Calcium homeostasis and bone formation / resorption This remodelling process is a balanced sequence where bone resorption precedes bone formation.
